questions.instruction: Match the proverbs with their meanings (from worksheet)

left_column.text: A stitch in time saves nine
Where there is a will, there is a way
Honesty is the best policy
Practice makes perfect

right_column.text: Truthfulness is always rewarded
Practice makes a person perfect
Acting early prevents bigger problems
Hard work leads to success

questions.instruction: Match the proverbs with their meanings

left_column.text: Don't count your chickens before they hatch
Actions speak louder than words
The early bird catches the worm
Don't judge a book by its cover

right_column.text: Those who act early have an advantage
Don't judge things or people by their appearance
What you do matters more than what you say
Don't be overconfident about something that hasn't happened yet

questions.instruction: Match the proverbs with their meanings

left_column.text: Too many cooks spoil the broth
Rome wasn't built in a day
When in Rome, do as the Romans do
A penny saved is a penny earned

right_column.text: Saving money is as important as earning it
Great things take time to accomplish
Adapt to local customs and behavior
Too many people involved in a task can ruin it

questions.instruction: Match the proverbs with their meanings

left_column.text: Better late than never
Look before you leap
Necessity is the mother of invention
All that glitters is not gold

right_column.text: Not everything that looks valuable is actually valuable
Need drives people to create solutions
It's better to do something late than not do it at all
Think carefully before acting

questions.instruction: Match the proverbs with their meanings

left_column.text: Birds of a feather flock together
Every cloud has a silver lining
Two wrongs don't make a right
An apple a day keeps the doctor away

right_column.text: Responding to wrongdoing with wrongdoing is not justified
Healthy habits prevent illness
There is something good in every bad situation
People with similar interests spend time together

questions.instruction: Match the proverbs with their meanings

left_column.text: A bird in the hand is worth two in the bush
Beggars can't be choosers
The pen is mightier than the sword
You can't have your cake and eat it too

right_column.text: You can't have everything both ways
Writing and words are more powerful than violence
When you need something, you can't be picky
What you have is more valuable than what you might get

questions.instruction: Match the proverbs with their meanings

left_column.text: A watched pot never boils
Barking dogs seldom bite
Blood is thicker than water
Curiosity killed the cat

right_column.text: Being too curious can lead to trouble
Family bonds are stronger than other relationships
Those who threaten often don't act
Time seems slower when you wait impatiently

questions.instruction: Match the proverbs with their meanings

left_column.text: Empty vessels make the most noise
Fortune favours the brave
Great minds think alike
Haste makes waste

right_column.text: Rushing leads to mistakes and wastage
Smart people often have similar ideas
Those with little knowledge talk the most
Bold people are more likely to succeed

questions.instruction: Match the proverbs with their meanings

left_column.text: Ignorance is bliss
Jack of all trades, master of none
Knowledge is power
Laughter is the best medicine

right_column.text: Being happy helps you feel better
Being informed gives you an advantage
Someone who does many things but excels at nothing
Sometimes not knowing is better

questions.instruction: Match the proverbs with their meanings

left_column.text: Make hay while the sun shines
No pain, no gain
Out of sight, out of mind
The grass is always greener on the other side

right_column.text: We forget things we don't see often
Other people's situations always seem better than ours
You must work hard to achieve results
Take advantage of opportunities when available
